issues.description: The template’s addGuestStudents method signature includes an extra boolean parameter (`validateInput`), but the problem statement and solution define it as a single-parameter method `addGuestStudents(int)`. This mismatch will prevent students from implementing the intended method signature and cause compilation or test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: In the template, change the method signature to `public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents)` (remove the boolean parameter) so it matches the problem specification and the solution.

issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify a method addGuestStudents(int) with a single integer parameter, but the template repository defines addGuestStudents(int, boolean), introducing an extra parameter `validateInput`. The solution uses the intended single-parameter signature. This mismatch will confuse students who attempt to implement the method as specified in the exercise.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the template’s stub signature to public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) to match the problem statement and solution repository.
